column4: no I am reformatting it.  It did exactly the same to my last install which was a clean drive (320 gigs)
I selected manual partition during install as I wanted to set my own partition sizes.
I know it will use the entire drive without a problem if I let it, but I don't want that.
I have the swap partition still.  I'll remove it and try again
Its still doing it and free space is the last thing on the drive
I'll whipe the drive completely and start over
COuld you restate your problem when you get a chance.. Just woke up here and trying to catch up
First partition for XP or something?
Are you crteating an extended partition and putting logical swap into that?
What error are you getting?
I try to use gparted from the live cd and not feed it through the installer
Use Terminal and type gconf-editor browse to /apps/nautilus/desktop
Is that an intel hda card?
If interested, here is what I used this am, to get mine going  http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/55921/
I see from a quick google that its a bug.

post a link please...  I know works for me is not a good answer but  I have a 00:1b.0 Audio device: Intel Corporation 82801FB/FBM/FR/FW/FRW (ICH6 Family) High Definition Audio Controller (rev 03) card
What does lspci show for yours
I solved it.  For some reason hibernating lowers one of the sound controls to zero.  Easily fixed in the sound panel.
great
I am busy, but I would have him run livecd and sudo fdisk -l  first
http://pastebin.org/46305  This is the output from sudo fdisk -l  His damaged boot partition is on sda3
Sorry, but I am not taking on other questions at this time. just pointing you in the right direction
It requires a special vice modem and special windows software.  To the best of my knowledge, there is no equivalent.  If you find one.. Please msg me here so I can check it out.. thanks
